p: We found no significant differences in the biomass production of Pueraria between treatments during early growth stages (i.e., after 60 days; Figure 4). In mid‐growth stages (i.e., 90 days), Pueraria biomass started to increase gradually as the ratio of Mikania to Pueraria increased (Figure 4). After 120 days of growth, Pueraria grown with high‐density Mikania (i.e., 1P3M) produced the most biomass (Figure 4).
